com.github.jvirtualhosts.management.apache
Class VirtualHostEntry

java.lang.Object
  com.github.jvirtualhosts.management.apache.VirtualHostEntry

public class VirtualHostEntry
extends Object

Represents as single VirtualHost tag. The member names are equal to their respective representations in the template file: hostname == $hostname$ basedir == $basedir$ etc...

Author:
Mario Mueller

getBasedir

public String getBasedir()
Returns the basedir of the server, which might be the same as the document root.

Returns:
the path to the basedir as string

setBasedir

public void setBasedir(String basedir)
Sets the basedir as string. Remember, that the document root must be located within the basedir's child structure. Like: - Basedir: /var/www/somecustomer - DocRoot: /var/www/somecustomer/subdomain.example.com/htdocs

Parameters:
basedir -

getDirectoryConfig

public String getDirectoryConfig()
Gets the full config for the basedir (Options, AllowOverride, etc.)

Returns:
the full config stack for the basedir, separated by "\n"

setDirectoryConfig

public void setDirectoryConfig(String directoryConfig)
Sets the full config stack for the basedir (Options, AllowOverride, etc.)

Parameters:
directoryConfig - the full config for the basedir separated by a newline (\n)

getExtraConfig

public String getExtraConfig()
Gets all the extra config lines

Returns:
the configuration that has been added by the user. Put things like "\n" etc. in here.

setExtraConfig

public void setExtraConfig(String extraConfig)
Sets the extra config settings for the host.

Parameters:
extraConfig - You can put something like Location tags, JKMount Settings ruby env or passenger configs in here, separated by a newline char (\n)

toString

public String toString()
This method can be used to generate a list of host entries and put it into a vector for the list view.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
the hostname, like "www.example.com"

renderTemplate

public String renderTemplate()
Renders the template given in VirtualHostEntry.TEMPLATE combined with the values of this instance. Be sure to check the values first, there is no validation while rendering the template!

Returns:
rendered template
